thread.title: Jeremy Corbyn SNAPS at presenter and accuses BBC of promoting 'fake news'
thread.title_full: Jeremy Corbyn SNAPS at presenter and accuses BBC of promoting 'fake news'

title: Jeremy Corbyn SNAPS at presenter and accuses BBC of promoting 'fake news'
text:
Jeremy Corbyn SNAPS at presenter and accuses BBC of promoting 'fake news' Jeremy Corbyn SNAPS at presenter and accuses BBC of promoting 'fake news' JEREMY CORBYN snapped at a BBC journalist and accused the corporation of reporting on fake news as he was grilled over reports he was considering resigning as Labour leader. PUBLISHED: 08: 49, Thu, Feb 9, 2017 
In a tetchy and often-bad tempered interview, the Islington North MP was accused of handing the Tories a “blank cheque” over Brexit after voting for the bill to trigger Article 50. 
Earlier this week unverified reports began to circulate that Mr Corbyn had settled on a date for his resignation with his inner circle. 
Speaking to Charlie Stayt on BBC Breakfast , Mr Corbyn was asked: “There is a story going about that you have set a date for when you are going to quit as Labour leader?” 
Mr Corbyn replied: “That is in the ‘I made it up yesterday.com’” 
The 67-year-old said the report was “absolute nonsense”. BBC Jeremy Corbyn accused the BBC of promoting fake news 
“So your future as Labour leader is absolutely intact, you have not considered for a moment whether you as leader are damaging the party,” Stayt asked again. 
A clearly vexed Mr Corbyn said: “I am really surprised the BBC is reporting fake news. 
“I was elected leader of this party and I am very proud to lead this party.” 
He said he would continue to demand social justice in Britain and opposing the Government over social care and the NHS. 
Mr Corbyn has been accused by the Tories of leading a "hopelessly divided" Labour Party after a senior frontbencher quit the shadow cabinet to defy the leader's orders and vote against the Brexit Bill. BBC Mr Corbyn said there was no timetable for his resignation Related articles
